API.ADK

Class Driver

  • java.lang.Object
    • API.ADK.Driver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ConstantList

    public class Driver
extends java.lang.Object
implements ConstantList
    CANBlue Implementation of the Driver Class. This class should not be used directly. When using API_ADK, this class is created automatically and used internally.
    Author:
    hroesdiyono

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Driver.CANDevice
      Subclass CANDevice.

      Local Bluetooth adapter.

      Structure contains list of devices, controllers, message channels, including the name, number of each parts, and their connection status.

    • Field Detail

      • numberOfObject

        private static byte numberOfObject
        Keep the number of object for this class.

      • intDeviceList

        public static volatile DeviceList intDeviceList
        Structure contains list of devices, controllers, message channels, including the name, number of each parts, and their connection status. This structure is used internally and should be filled to be able to use the Driver. Call listPairedDevice(API.ADK.DeviceOnlyList), then use its parameter and this structure in checkForSupportedDevice(API.ADK.DeviceOnlyList, API.ADK.DeviceList).

      • drvBTAdapter

        private BluetoothAdapter drvBTAdapter
        Local Bluetooth adapter.

      • driverStatus

        volatile ReturnCode driverStatus
        Internal initialization status to make sure the object of this class has been initialize before using it and could not be used anymore after deinitializing it.

      • DRIVER_VERSION

        private static final java.lang.String DRIVER_VERSION
        The version string of the Driver.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • Driver

        private Driver()
        Private constructor, can only be called from inside the class.

    • Method Detail

      • createDriverObject

        public static Driver createDriverObject()
        Call this method to create this class object. The object can only be created once. When used with API_ADK, it is created automatically.
        Returns:
        Driver object or null if the object creation fails.

      • getDriverVersion

        public java.lang.String getDriverVersion()
        Return the version of the Driver.
        Returns:
        The string of the Driver version.

      • initializeObjects

        public ReturnCode initializeObjects()
        Initialize objects and variables for Driver class. Call this method only if it is used with the API_ADK. It synchronizes the content of intDeviceList with the one in API_ADK.
        Returns:
        ReturnCode.SUCCESS.

      • initializeCommunicationInterface

        public ReturnCode initializeCommunicationInterface()
        Initialize the communication interface. Call this method before calling any other method. Check whether the Bluetooth is available and turned on. Turn the Bluetooth on automatically if it is turned off.
        Returns:
        ReturnCode.SUCCESS, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_DEINITIALIZED, ReturnCode.FAIL_ACCESSING_BLUETOOTH, ReturnCode.BLUETOOTH_NOT_SUPPORTED, or ReturnCode.FAIL_TURNING_BLUETOOTH_ON.

      • deinitializeCommunicationInterface

        public ReturnCode deinitializeCommunicationInterface()
        Close the communication interface. Check whether all Driver.CANDevice objects have been deinitialized and turn the Bluetooth off. This method should be called before deinitializeObjects().
        Returns:
        ReturnCode.SUCCESS, ReturnCode.DEVICE_INSTANCE_STILL_OPEN, or ReturnCode.FAIL_TURNING_BLUETOOTH_OFF.

      • deinitializeObjects

        public ReturnCode deinitializeObjects()
        Destroy used objects and variables. This method should be called last, if the object is not used any more.
        Returns:
        ReturnCode.SUCCESS.

      • listPairedDevice

        public ReturnCode listPairedDevice(DeviceOnlyList pairedList)
        Return the list of all paired device.
        Parameters:
        pairedList - Output: List of all paired devices.
        Returns:
        ReturnCode.SUCCESS, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_DEINITIALIZED, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_NOT_INITIALIZED, ReturnCode.DEVICEONLYLIST_OBJECT_NOT_VALID, ReturnCode.MAXIMUM_BYTE_CAPACITY_REACH, or ReturnCode.NO_PAIRED_DEVICE.

      • checkForSupportedDevice

        public ReturnCode checkForSupportedDevice(DeviceOnlyList pairedList,
                                 DeviceList supportedList)
        Remove unsupported device and only return list of supported device and add their number of controllers by comparing from the database table.
        Parameters:
        pairedList - Input: List of all paired devices.
        supportedList - Output: List of supported devices.
        Returns:
        ReturnCode.SUCCESS, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_DEINITIALIZED, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_NOT_INITIALIZED, ReturnCode.DEVICEONLYLIST_OBJECT_NOT_VALID, ReturnCode.DEVICELIST_OBJECT_NOT_VALID, ReturnCode.NO_SUPPORTED_DEVICE, or ReturnCode.MAXIMUM_BYTE_CAPACITY_REACH.

      • createCANDeviceObject

        public Driver.CANDevice createCANDeviceObject(byte inputListIndex)
        Create an object of the CANDevice class.
        Parameters:
        inputListIndex - Input: The listIndex of intDeviceList value.
        Returns:
        Driver.CANDevice object or null if it is already created.
